image.altText: A graphic image showing the NDIS logo, a hand on a calculator, and stacks of folders.

props.synopsis: Disability was a key part of this year’s federal budget. Here are the key takeaways now the dust has settled.

title.children: From NDIS cost revisions to new employment program, what's in 2024 budget for disability?

image.altText: Jim Chalmers stands at the podium of the national press club

props.synopsis: With an eye to the next election, Treasurer Jim Chalmers spruiked what he saw as the government's economic achievements in last night's budget speech. But did he stick to the facts?

title.children: We fact checked some key claims from Jim Chalmers's budget speech. Here's what we found

image.altText: Hands holding a power bill

props.synopsis: Last night's budget had a few measures that could put extra money in your pocket. But don't expect a cheque in the mail or a bonus payment directly into your bank account.

title.children: How you'll get the $300 energy rebate promised in last night's budget

image.altText: Man sits in parliament

props.synopsis: The 2024 Federal Budget has been handed down, and the government is hitting the airwaves to sell it to the public. Follow live.

title.children: Government defends its 2024 budget, accused of getting 'priorities wrong' by opposition in Question Time

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: MP says energy bill credit will 'barely cover' cost increases
Treasurer on domestic violence: 'We know we need to do more'

image.altText: Federal budget booklets sits on a table.

props.synopsis: The federal budget is in its second year of surplus, but is poised to fall back into deficit for the next decade. Why? And should we be worried?

title.children: The budget deficit in four graphs and 400 words

image.altText: Jim Chalmers holds a copy of the 2024-25 budget outside of Parliament House

props.synopsis: The federal budget has revealed every household will be receiving a $300 energy discount.

title.children: Giving $300 energy bill relief to everyone was the easiest way to help, treasurer says

image.altText: A woman with curly hair, carrying her dog, standing outside a colourfully-decorated red yurt.

props.synopsis: When renting became unaffordable, single mum Beck Meyers started camping on a bush block she bought with a friend. Now, she, her children, and her friend are at risk of being evicted into homelessness by their local council.

title.children: 'Bureaucracy gone mad': Family told to leave their own land

image.altText: Collage of scrabble letters W + L with blue and red backgrounds and icon illustrations.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has handed down the government's third budget. Have a look at what's new — and what's in it for you.

title.children: These are the winners and losers in this year's budget

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Anthony Albanese sit on a couch holding the budget booklets. They are smiling.

props.synopsis: Below the radio grabs and the inevitable "does my budget look inflationary in this?" back-and-forth of the budget, there are two fascinating and revelatory stories.

title.children: The two fascinating stories thrumming under the budget radio clips

image.altText: a drone photo taken above streets with dark roofed houses

props.synopsis: The Albanese government dedicated a special chapter in its budget to Australia's housing crisis, and it used these graphs to illustrate the problem.

title.children: Australia's housing crisis in 10 graphs, from the federal budget

image.altText: Shiny silver coins on display inside the Mint with an effigy of King Charles III on the back.

props.synopsis: The first full proof set of Australian coins bearing the face of King Charles III was unveiled at the Royal Australian Mint in Canberra today, and they've been described as "a beautiful memento of an important change in the framework of Australia".

title.children: For the first time in 59 years, a king will appear on all of Australia's newly minted coins

image.altText: Cam McCarthy kicks for the Dockers during 2019 AFL season.

props.synopsis: Fremantle coach Justin Longmuir says the AFL community can do more to help former players following the death of Cam McCarthy at the age of 29.

title.children: AFL urged to do more for struggling past players following former Docker's death

image.altText: A man standing in front of a building with his arms crossed and a cap in his hand

props.synopsis: The National Centre for Farmer Health is reeling after having its funding slashed in the Victorian budget, with directors facing "hard decisions" about its future.

title.children: Nearly $1m cut from farmers' health service that 'saves lives'

image.altText: A person's arms are pictured shaping a heart with its hands, behind it a large round portal in which people in Dublin are seen

props.synopsis: Officials have hit a pause on a video screen called The Portal that lets people in New York and Dublin peer into life on opposite sides of the Atlantic in real time.

title.children: Sidewalk video portal connecting New York and Dublin paused after spectators caught misbehaving on camera

image.altText: A distraught middle-aged man and woman stand in front of a grey curtain

props.synopsis: It's been almost two weeks since Kye Schaefer was fatally stabbed in Coffs Harbour. His parents are calling on the person responsible to be "honest and own up".

title.children: Parents of 21-year-old stabbed to death while heading for a surf issue tearful plea to killer

image.altText: boy with brown hair and missing tooth smiles as he cuddles a sleeping kitten on the couch.

props.synopsis: Parents who lost their seven-year-old son just before Christmas when he was hit by a car while walking home with his sisters are urging the NSW government make the Sturt Highway safer.

title.children: Boy's death at intersection prompts grief-stricken plea for pedestrian safety overhaul

image.altText: A composite image of an older man and an older woman smiling.

props.synopsis: A daughter of slain camper Carol Clay could be among those to give evidence in the murder trial of her mother's alleged killer Greg Lynn, as the ex-pilot's murder trial enters its second day of evidence.

title.children: Witnesses to be called as High Country double murder trial enters second day of evidence

image.altText: A man sits on the bed of an MRI machine looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Richard Scolyer, who has treated his stage four brain cancer using his own research, has announced his latest scans show no new cancer growth one year after his initial diagnosis.

title.children: Australian of the Year brain cancer free one year on from diagnosis

image.altText: Meryl Streep in a white dress and sunglasses, arms outstretched, head thrown back, beneath the Cannes symbol

props.synopsis: Here's your run-down of the most-hyped films, Australian offerings and potential controversies at the 77th annual Festival de Cannes.

title.children: Furiosa, a Trump biopic, honours for Meryl and protests: What to expect from Cannes Film Festival 24

image.altText: Conversation between brunette mother with daughter talking on beige sofa and living room in their home

props.synopsis: Experts say children have probably already been exposed to the issues of gendered and family violence and it's important to speak about them.

title.children: Family violence is a distressing issue for adults — so how do you talk about it with kids?

image.altText: Sage the Black poodle struts around the ring

props.synopsis: Sage emerged victorious from more than 2,500 top-ranked canines competing in a two-day contest.

title.children: Sage the miniature poodle fetches top prize at prestigious US dog show

image.altText: Ajla Tomljanovic  pumps her left fist as she celebrates an Australian Open first-round win.

props.synopsis: After missing the tournament last year, Ajla Tomljanovic will make her first appearance at Roland-Garros since 2022 after receiving a wildcard.

title.children: Ajla Tomljanovic's two-year French Open drought set to end as Aussie receives wildcard

image.altText: Police standing in a line.

props.synopsis: One person was shot dead and two others have been wounded as violent protests and looting rock New Caledonia, according to the high commissioner of the French Pacific territory.

title.children: One person shot dead, two wounded as France sends more police to New Caledonia

image.altText: A photo graphic of a blurred-out young male on a mobile phone sitting in front of a laptop.

props.synopsis: For up to four weeks, Alex and his family received up to 50 food deliveries a day after his address was shared by someone he had an argument with while playing Call of Duty online. Here's what to do if, like Alex, you've been doxxed.

title.children: Alex was doxxed while playing Call of Duty. What happened next was a living nightmare for him and his family

image.altText: Legs of a female runner jogging in a park on an wet autumn afternoon, the path muddy and wet.

props.synopsis: Etiquette is all about putting the people around you at ease — that principle applies to running. And getting it right can help us all to feel safe.

title.children: 'Keep your distance': Runners share their running etiquette tips

image.altText: Planet WASP-193b V2

props.synopsis: The new planet, named WASP-193b, appears to dwarf Jupiter in size, yet researchers found it's the second-lightest planet discovered to date.

title.children: Scientists discover 'super fluffy' planet with the same density as fairy floss

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou wears a hooded coat in the rain

props.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou railed against a philosophy at Tottenham that saw portions of home support actively willing Spurs to lose against Manchester City to help deny arch-rivals Arsenal the Premier League title. It's highlighted to him how hard a job he has to turn Tottenham into winners.

title.children: Spurs fans wanted to lose to Manchester City, and Ange was furious about it

image.altText: Twin sisters standing back to back smiling at the camera in very colourful tops

props.synopsis: Georgia Laurie repeatedly hit the reptile in the nose to save her sister while swimming in a river in Mexico in 2021.

title.children: Twin who punched crocodile to save her sister receives King's medal for bravery

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The March quarter Wage Price Index shows wages are still rising but the pace is slowing. The Australian share market is up a day after the federal budget revealed cost-of-living relief and $22.7 billion of long-term spending on clean energy and strategic industries. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Wage rises slow, the ASX is up, and Anglo American to sell Queensland coal mines

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX stays higher in afternoon session
Wages data could put interest rate hike talk to bed

image.altText: A historical statue cut down and vandalised.

props.synopsis: A colonial-era statue honouring a former premier who mutilated the body of an Aboriginal man is vandalised on the eve of a tribunal decision on its planned removal.

title.children: 'What goes around': Former premier's statue chopped down in the night, a day after vandals' first attempt

image.altText: Snowtown accomplice Mark Haydon in a cap and jumper.

props.synopsis: Last-minute measures to monitor and control Snowtown accomplice Mark Ray Haydon have been imposed days before the 65-year-old's sentence is set to end and he is released into the community.

title.children: Days before his sentence ends, bodies-in-the-barrels accomplice has control measures imposed

image.altText: A man wearing a mask walks out of a GameStop store.

props.synopsis: GameStop and AMC Entertainment are again capturing retail investors' attention, reminiscent of the meme stock frenzy that gripped Wall Street three years ago. Here's why.

title.children: Meme stocks are roaring again. This time it may be different
